advertisements: Wednesday, The Poor Gentleman; with additional Dances, and Aerial Flights, by the Mademoiselles Ferzi and the Young American.
Friday, a Play and Entertainments (being the last Night of the Company's performing.)

featuredAttractionsForShow: Mademoiselle S. Ferzi, in addition to her usual Performances on the Tight Rope, will introduce her admired Grotesque Pas Seul of the unequalled Madame Gardell, Principal Dancer at the Opera House in Paris; also her Castanet Pollacca, and (by desire) her admired Flag and Scots' Dances.
For the first time here, the Young American's unrivalled Antepodean Exercises! Surrounded in a brilliant discharge of Saxon Fire.

After which (for the first time here) Mademoiselle N. Ferzi will perform her graceful Evolutions on the Alambre Floxo; in the course of which, she will introduce a Variety of Extraordinary Feats peculiar to herself
After which, The Young American's wonderful Performances on the Flying Rope, who will conclude with an Aerial Flight of Somersaults.
Also, the Two Mademoiselles Ferzis' graceful performances on the Double Rope.
A Comic Song by Mr. Sheppard
A Comic Song by Mr. Fromow

performances.title: The Dramatist, or Stop Him Who Can?

ticketing.toBeHad: to be had of Mr. Earl: also to be had of G. Stretton, Printer hereof.
